Nib
  • Nib  
  • Animation

Animation

Animations bring your UI to life with smooth transitions.

Animation Class

class nib.Animation(type, duration=None, delay=None, response=None, damping=None)[source]

Bases: object

Animation configuration for view transitions.

Parameters:

  • type (str)

  • duration (Optional[float])

  • delay (Optional[float])

  • response (Optional[float])

  • damping (Optional[float])

type: str
duration: Optional[float] = None
delay: Optional[float] = None
response: Optional[float] = None
damping: Optional[float] = None
default = Animation(type='easeInOut', duration=0.3, delay=None, response=None, damping=None)
fast = Animation(type='easeOut', duration=0.15, delay=None, response=None, damping=None)
slow = Animation(type='easeInOut', duration=0.5, delay=None, response=None, damping=None)
bouncy = Animation(type='spring', duration=None, delay=None, response=0.3, damping=0.5)
classmethod linear(duration=0.3)[source]

Create a linear animation.

Parameters:

duration (float)

Return type:

Animation

classmethod easeIn(duration=0.3)[source]

Create an ease-in animation (slow start, fast end).

Parameters:

duration (float)

Return type:

Animation

classmethod easeOut(duration=0.3)[source]

Create an ease-out animation (fast start, slow end).

Parameters:

duration (float)

Return type:

Animation

__init__(type, duration=None, delay=None, response=None, damping=None)
Parameters:

  • type (str)

  • duration (Optional[float])

  • delay (Optional[float])

  • response (Optional[float])

  • damping (Optional[float])

classmethod easeInOut(duration=0.3)[source]

Create an ease-in-out animation (slow start and end).

Parameters:

duration (float)

Return type:

Animation

classmethod spring(response=0.3, damping=0.7)[source]

Create a spring animation.

Parameters:

  • response (float) How quickly the spring settles (lower = faster)

  • damping (float) How much the spring bounces (0 = forever, 1 = no bounce)

Return type:

Animation

to_dict()[source]
Return type:

dict

Creating Animations

Spring Animation (Recommended)

nib.Animation.spring()
nib.Animation.spring(duration=0.5)
nib.Animation.spring(bounce=0.3)

Ease Animations

nib.Animation.easeIn(duration=0.3)
nib.Animation.easeOut(duration=0.3)
nib.Animation.easeInOut(duration=0.3)

Linear Animation

nib.Animation.linear(duration=0.5)

Applying Animations

Add the animation parameter to any view:

nib.Text(
    "Animated",
    animation=nib.Animation.spring(),
)

nib.Rectangle(
    fill=nib.Color.BLUE,
    width=100,
    height=100,
    animation=nib.Animation.easeInOut(0.3),
)

Content Transitions

Animate how content changes:

class nib.ContentTransition(value, names=<not given>, *values, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)[source]

Bases: str, Enum

Content transition types for animating content changes.

Used with Text to animate how content changes are displayed.

Example

Text(f{count}, content_transition=ContentTransition.NUMERIC_TEXT) Text(f{count}, content_transition=ContentTransition.NUMERIC_TEXT_DOWN)

IDENTITY = 'identity'
INTERPOLATE = 'interpolate'
NUMERIC_TEXT = 'numericText'
NUMERIC_TEXT_DOWN = 'numericTextDown'
OPACITY = 'opacity'
identity = 'identity'
interpolate = 'interpolate'
numericText = 'numericText'
numericTextDown = 'numericTextDown'
opacity = 'opacity'
nib.Text(
    counter_value,
    content_transition=nib.ContentTransition.NUMERICTEXT,
)

Available transitions:

nib.ContentTransition.OPACITY       # Fade in/out
nib.ContentTransition.INTERPOLATE   # Smooth interpolation
nib.ContentTransition.NUMERICTEXT   # Number counter animation

View Transitions

Animate view appearance/disappearance:

class nib.Transition(value, names=<not given>, *values, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)[source]

Bases: str, Enum

View transition types for appearance/disappearance animations.

Used to animate how views enter and exit the view hierarchy.

Example

Text(Hello, transition=Transition.OPACITY) VStack([], transition=Transition.SLIDE)

IDENTITY = 'identity'
OPACITY = 'opacity'
SCALE = 'scale'
SLIDE = 'slide'
MOVE_LEADING = 'moveLeading'
MOVE_TRAILING = 'moveTrailing'
MOVE_TOP = 'moveTop'
MOVE_BOTTOM = 'moveBottom'
PUSH = 'push'
identity = 'identity'
opacity = 'opacity'
scale = 'scale'
slide = 'slide'
moveLeading = 'moveLeading'
moveTrailing = 'moveTrailing'
moveTop = 'moveTop'
moveBottom = 'moveBottom'
push = 'push'
nib.VStack(
    controls=[...],
    transition=nib.Transition.SLIDE,
)

Available transitions:

nib.Transition.OPACITY    # Fade
nib.Transition.SLIDE      # Slide from edge
nib.Transition.SCALE      # Scale up/down
nib.Transition.MOVE       # Move from direction
nib.Transition.PUSH       # Push old content out

Examples

Animated Counter

counter = nib.Text(
    "0",
    font=nib.Font.LARGE_TITLE,
    content_transition=nib.ContentTransition.NUMERICTEXT,
    animation=nib.Animation.spring(),
)

def increment():
    counter.content = str(int(counter.content) + 1)

Animated Color Change

box = nib.Rectangle(
    fill=nib.Color.BLUE,
    width=100,
    height=100,
    animation=nib.Animation.easeInOut(0.5),
)

def toggle_color():
    if box._fill == nib.Color.BLUE:
        box.fill = nib.Color.RED
    else:
        box.fill = nib.Color.BLUE

Loading Spinner with Animation

nib.ProgressView(
    animation=nib.Animation.linear(duration=1.0),
)
